name: Lancaster Red Roof Inn

reviews.text: We went to this hotel because it was extremely close to Dutch Wonderland. We were 4 families with two small children each. We were there overnight from Sat. 7/12 to Sun. 7/13. The purpose of our visit was to see Amish Country and mainly to visit Dutch Wonderland with our kids.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, and close to all attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleasantly surprised that the Red Roof Inn was close to everything...Amish tours,Target, other convenience stores, outlets malls, next door (litteraly) to Texas Roadhouse restaurant, Applebees, Fuddruckers, and yes of course, down the street from Dutch Wonderland.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant

reviews.text: Check in was quick, the rooms were very clean (all 4 that we got) with a microwave and mini-fridge. Air conditioning worked too well (I froze and had to turn it off). There was also a small outdoor pool which we didn't use because we were there only overnight.
reviews.title: Nice hotel.
Planning to stay again
reviews.text: Breakfast was from 6-9am, but they didn't start taking food away until 9:30am. There was everything from fresh waffles (you pour the batter yourself onto the griddle) to bagels, muffins, oatmeal, hard boiled eggs, cheerios, frosted flakes, bananas, oranges, juices, coffees, and hot chocolate.

reviews.title: Very Satisfied Especially with Room 228 King
reviews.text: It's not a 5 star hotel, it's a very nice motel. It was just what we were looking for for a short trip. We paid $89 (incuding tax) per night. This was with the AAA discount. Call the hotel directly (like we did), you will get a cheaper rate than any of the online travel sites.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely enjoyed the stay. We enjoyed it because the staff was I believe the best and courteous. Great Continental breakfast. The hotel looks brand new. My wife and I often come for the Sight & Sound shows. The rooms were very clean, great Red Roof Product. It felt definitely on a higher end. I stayed at this hotel last year, a little disappointed. However, they assured it would be different the next time. And it absolutely was different. Everything was new! The drapery, the carpet, furniture, bathrooms are all renovated. Overall great experience and great price. My suggestion... Take it, Excellent Lobby and Breakfast area.
reviews.title: Loved the Staff & Room!

reviews.text: This place was great; it was close to Amish Country, nice staff, SUPERB Continental Breakfast (had a waffle iron; however, it had some over-heating problems; glad they had 2). The room was a bit dark, but clean!! It served its purpose: sleep, shower & breakfast = )
reviews.title: Great Place, Great Location & Great Continental Breakfast
Don't think I'll be going back
reviews.text: I have been traveling to Lancaster, PA for over 20 years. This is my second visit to the Red Roof Inn, (formerly McIntosh Inn). Our visit was very pleasant last year this time, but this time it was not so nice. I was traveling with a group of 25 persons and we had 10 rooms booked. Needless to say, the hotel is booked this time of year. One of the couples traveling with us had no heat in the room and contacted maintenance as soon as we arrived. Needless to say, they slept in a cold room that night. My husband proceeded to take a shower the next morning, only to have the tub stop up and fill up with sewer. We had to shower in one of the other guest rooms! Neither problem got fixed before we left and we stayed 2 nights. The staff was only willing to give a 15% discount on a $1100.00 bill! I think next year I will take my group and money elsewhere.
SB, WDC
reviews.title: Way less than what I expected
Great Stay
reviews.text: I am usually not a fussy traveler and look for three basic things in a hotel: clean and functional rooms, internet access and complimentary breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over the last 8 or 9 years my wife and I celebrate our wedding anniversary (January 4th) in Lancaster even before it was a Red Roof Inn. We celebrated our 54th anniversary this year. We enjoy the breakfast and quietness.
reviews.title: Centrally located in Dutch Country near outlets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed over for one night at the Red Roof Inn of Lancaster on our way to the Penn State area. This particular Red Roof is a "breath of fresh air," in that it isn't a carbon copy of every other one of their inns! Even the windows are a refreshing change from the typical hotel look. We arrived an hour early and thought we'd take a chance at the desk, where we were greeted warmly and allowed to check in right away. We stayed in room 201, and it was spotlessly clean and bright, both in the sleeping and bathroom areas, and the amount of counter, desk top and dresser space is wonderful. Our TV worked just fine, and had a very clear picture. We couldn't hear any sound from the rooms around us. Also, we were pleasantly surprised to find that their parking lot accesses the restaurants and stores next door, so we were able to turn left onto busy Route 30 at a traffic light. The Red Roof is so convenient to the Rockvale Outlets, American Music Theatre and most other attractions (especially with that light!) We were told that there was breakfast available, but didn't bother checking it out - after all, this is Pennsylvania Dutch Country! A couple of days after our trip, we were horrified to realize we'd forgotten to leave a tip for the housekeeper, who had smiled and wished us a nice day as we left. I emailed the hotel to ask if I could mail a tip for her, since she'd obviously done a nice job with our room. All I got back was a reply thanking me for staying at their hotel, saying "my comments would motivate their staff to work even harder!" I was really impressed by that. Beyond all that I have said here, I'd like to add that it's so nice to find a place to stay in Lancaster that charges such a reasonable rate. It makes it possible for us to go to the area more often, and spend our money on sites and shopping, rather than sleeping!
reviews.title: Try It... You Won't be Disappointed!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Price is right. Lobby and breakfast area look clean and have nice shiny floors. Location of motel is convenient but surrounded by restaurant parking lot and noisy traffic, no ambience at all. From road outside looks pretty new, but not once you get close. Pets are allowed. Room 227 had large stain on carpet (pets?), dark chip on mirror (no big deal), TV picture was VERY fuzzy. I complained twice, they came and jiggled the wires to get better picture, but I had to repeat the process many times during the night. Room is noisy through walls and especially from people walking by your room talking. Traffic can be heard from road.
reviews.title: If you want cheap but aren't fussy about cleanliness, this is for you

reviews.text: MAIN COMPLAINT: Bathroom: Dull finish on tub, probably from body oils and soap scum not being properly cleaned (use vinegar and scrub with baking soda -- cheap!). Chrome fixtures also dull, spotted and seemed to have smudges like from fingerprints. Grout around tub support handle had black mold and yellow grime that looked like it could be scrubbed off if attempted. Tub and walls showed drip lines thru grey-dull finish. Tub floor non-slip surface was discolored gray with what looked like foot grime. Robe hook on back of door was loose and jiggly. Wall-to-floor seam behind door looked caked with past crud, Grout seams discolored and dirty-looking.
reviews.title: Reasonable and adequate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Seeing all this made me wonder how clean the linens were. I had asked that no unwashed bedspread be in room and when I arrived there was one of those old-fashioned quilted bedspreads on the bed, and I don't think they wash those.
reviews.title: Ok Stay but......

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights while visiting Lancaster and Dutch Wonderland, which is just a very short distance down the road.
reviews.title: Good value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is excellent, again very close to Dutch Wonderland, as well as many restaurants and both the Horizon and Tanger Outlets, plus a short drive from all the Amish and railway-related attractions. Front-desk reception was efficient and very polite.
reviews.title: The Amish View

likes.liked: — steps from wonderland, restaurants, 300 outlet stores

reviews.text: The room is smallish, but it appears that the bedroom set was recently upgraded as it was surpisingly nice for what I'd consider to be a budget hotel. The room was mostly quiet, the bed was comfortable, the linens and most of the room was quite clean. We liked the vanity outside the washroom with two sinks, plus we didn't expect to get a microwave and fridge! They have a pool and breakfast, neither of which we took advantage of.
reviews.title: Surpassed my expectations

likes.disliked: — the continental breakfast but hey, it was free

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were a couple of negatives regarding the bathroom. The shower curtain absolutely stunk, I don't know when it was last replaced or washed. As well, the non-slip liner in the bathtub was peeling off, exposing brown crud which was absolutely disgusting. This bothered me because I had to give my son his bath in this tub - fortunately we always bring cleaning agents and sponges to give the tub an extra wash, but I still didn't feel comfortable about it, so I made his bath very quick and made especially certain he didn't drink the bathwater!
reviews.title: Did not like the pillows

reviews.text: Also, the hotel is located by a hill on the the busy US-30, so at night we often heard trucks applying their air brakes. Not much we or the hotel could do about that.
reviews.title: NOT UP TO ACCOR'S STANDARDS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We been vacationing in Lancaster for many years.
reviews.title: DIRTY AND RUDE

reviews.text: The Hotel that we usually stay was booked so I looked on line and found that "The Red Roof Inn" had an opening, so we made online reservations plus gave a phone call to the Hotel, to make sure we will have the first floor because of my disability.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: When we entered the hotel the one young girl there was very rude to us she got our name and just handed us the room key without saying a word to us.
reviews.title: OK, but could be better

likes.liked: — Easy access to restaurants, area attractions

reviews.text: I asked her what room was ours and to my surprise she said the second floor.
reviews.title: Great value.

likes.liked: — The value, the en suite fridge & microwave.
likes.disliked: — My room was smelly the first evening.

reviews.text: I told her that I requested the first floor and she stated that she can't give the first floor that was promised. She said I could take the elevator to the second floor.
reviews.title: Good value, good location, updated Hotel

likes.disliked: — No hair dryer as promised on the website

reviews.text: The staff is helpful and courteous. We enjoy the breakfast that is available to the guests. Have to mention the cleanliness of the rooms and the location of the Red Roof which is convenient to shopping and dinning.
reviews.title: Great value for the money.

reviews.text: Nice freindly staff greeted me at the counter and the check in process was quick and simple. The lobby is very home friendly and even has a fireplace which provides a great feeling. The location in the Lancaster area was great. After trying several hotels in the area I decided that this is the cleanest & most cost effective place to stay. I even joined the Red Roof club to earn points.
reviews.title: Weekend Stay in Lancaster Pa.

reviews.text: We went to Lancaster, PA for the weekend to visit family in the area. I brought two small dogs with us. Stayed at Red Roof because they are a pet friendly hotel. The hotel is centrally located. The hotel was clean and well kept. I had no complaints with stay.
reviews.title: Lancaster, PA

reviews.text: This hotel has bed bugs. Was there 1/13-1/16 in room 225. Discovered bites the first morning but thought they were from an allergy. Woke up the next morning to more red marks which made me uneasy. I pulled back the sheets to check and did not see anything. Later that evening I discovered a bed bug on the pillow. Called the front desk, told them of the problem and requested management. He did not seem surprised by what I was saying. Was told the manager would not be in until 8 am Monday (it was around midnight). Was given another room (which the front desk person deemed bug free from a 2 minute inspection) but obviously I could not sleep. Sat in a chair and waited til morning to check out. At checkout the manager (Jay) was at the front desk but from what I could tell he had not been advised of the problem. He also advised that the owner of the franchise had not been notified. Not sure of proper protocol but, in my opinion bed bugs are a serious issue and as such require immediate attention. Management shoul have been called ASAP! The nonchalant attitude of the staff was surprising. I explained what happened and demaned a full refund. He offered a one night refund which was completely unacceptable. After becoming beligerent he agreed to return the full 3 night stay. For those wondering, I did check trip advisor priior to booking this hotel and found glowing reports for the most part. However, it appears I did not go back far enough in my search because while sitting up the entire night I checked again and found that on 5/17/11 there was another bed bug complaint which, according to that poster fell on deaf ears. I have no doubt that they placed someone else in room 225 before exterminating, even mentioned that to Jay and he did not deny it.. I would never stay there again.
reviews.title: BED BUGS

reviews.text: Booked on Hotwire way worth the price very clean and warm room good for a one night stay conveniently located on Lincoln highway very close to all the outlets short drive to downtown Lancaster only issue was that the walls are a little thin I could hear what was going on around me but otherwise it was good I would stay again
reviews.title: Pretty Average Good Overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel - and I wasn't sure what to expect. The rooms were clean and it was centrally located. The reason why I'm giving them 4 stars is that the guy at the front desk John went above and beyond for me. First he allowed me to check in early and then after I forgot my phone charger after checking out, he coordinated FedEx pick up and shipped it out to me immediately. Thank you John!
reviews.title: Clean and excellent customer service

reviews.text: The motel was very close to the meeting (across the street), and convenient to several restaurants. It was located near most of the attractions in the lancaster, Pa. area. I stayed two nights with no problems (except snow on the road - not the fault of Red Roof).
reviews.title: Historic Miniature Gaming Meeting

reviews.text: I've stayed at this location several times and always found it to my liking. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are basic, but clean, quiet and well maintained. In room Wi-Fi and a desktop in the lobby with Internet access are also nice touches. There is free coffee at all hours and a continental breakfast available every morning.
reviews.title: A Good Night's Sleep at a Good Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel based upon the reviews and the fact that we were going to have a hire car as it is not in town. We were not disappointed. We appreciated the elevator as our luggage was heavy. The room was an older style however it was very functional and contained a coffee maker, a bar fridge and a microwave. I found the bed to be very comfortable but the pillows were too firm for my liking. We also got free carparking and free wireless internet. We did hear a noise outside the room which may have been the air-conditioning but it did not disturb us at all. The room itself was very large and we had lots of room to put our luggage.
reviews.title: would stay again

reviews.text: The hotel is surrounded by restaurants and activities so it is a good location to be in, especially as we only we only stayed for one night.
reviews.title: Thank you!

reviews.text: We have used this Red Roof various times when in Lancaster. The rooms are clean and the rates reasonable. It is nice that the hotel has an elevator.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: I actually stayed new years eve. This was the best hotel for a couple on a budget.. I recommend booking through the red roof inn website they sometimes have better deals. Our room (101) was at the very end on the first floor away from the highway. I didn't like that the room doors were exterior facing, but it was quiet and we didn't hear any road traffic. The room was clean but the shower didn't look very clean. The sink outside the bathroom was long and fit all of my products while I got ready. Did not have the breakfast because it was over by 9.. After a late night it would have been nice to have extended breakfast hours. I would stay again.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made a trip to Lancaster to celebrate my husband's birthday and our 50th wedding anniversary. The Red Roof was a very pleasant motel with a friendly staff as well as a very clean room. The breakfast buffet had a great selection, my husband's favorite - waffles. We did speak to the manager concerning only one chair in the room. In this day many older couples travel extensively, but usually settle in their room early to prepare for the following day. A second chair would definitely be expected. The handicapped accessible facility was very good and made our trip much more enjoyable. The rain was a bit much but we cannot fault the motel for the weather.
reviews.title: Wonderful Trip!

reviews.text: I am a repeat customer and I appreciate being recognized and having a good relationship with the front desk.
reviews.title: Each visit builds a relationship.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked through Orbitz and thought I was getting a great deal, $55. Recent reviews on tripadvisor were positive, so I was expecting something decent. You can read some of my other reviews and see that I'm not very picky, but this room just needed a GOOD CLEANING. When I arrived, check in was easy and we headed to our room. Walked into the room and it was 54 degrees, we had to keep our coats on for 1/2 hour! The couch in the room was disgusting, there were white, possibly stucko, flakes all around the edges of the room and the paint job in the bathroom was rididculous. The tiolet leaked around the base and there were water spots all over the mirror. Bed seemed fine, there was a stain on one of the pillows. Upon check-out, I was never asked how my stay was or anything.
reviews.title: Disappointed! Dirty room.

description: Red Roof Inn of Lancaster is a gem in the heart of Lancaster County’s Dutch Country. The hotel is made up of 95 spacious and elegantly appointed rooms. The recently updated property also features handicap accessible rooms, deluxe rooms and Jacuzzi suites. Location, location, location is the best way to describe the setting of this property. Red Roof Inn of Lancaster is ideally situated amongst the greatest Lancaster County theatres, attractions, eateries and shopping centers. All of this is fun and folly is literally footsteps or few moments drive away. With all of these things at your fingertips it is amazing to find the peace and serenity available on the property. A newly built deck overlooking an adjacent working farm is a pleasure on warm nights. A seasonal pool, ample on-site parking, season outdoor bar and many other wonderful amenities make this hotel, "The Right Hotel in the Right Location for the Right Price!"
